title: Moscow callback: When Modi first met Putin; photos from 2001 go viral
content: As President Putin prepares for a visit to India, old images of him with Prime Minister Modi from 2001 have resurfaced. Then Gujarat Chief Minister Modi accompanied PM Vajpayee to Moscow, marking his first international engagement and early diplomatic interaction with Putin. The visit fostered cooperation between Gujarat and Russia's Astrakhan region.

title: 'Despite geopolitical uncertainty': Rajnath hails ties with Russia; message for Trump?
content: India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reaffirmed the nation's steady defence partnership with Russia, despite global geopolitical uncertainty. The remarks were made during the 22nd India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission meeting, just before President Putin's arrival for the Annual Summit. Both ministers emphasized the strong, long-standing ties and ongoing cooperation across military and economic domains.

title: Organisers move Syed Mushtaq fixture after unusual crowd surge for Hardik Pandya
content: A Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match between Baroda and Gujarat was moved to a larger stadium due to security concerns arising from large crowds gathering to watch Hardik Pandya. Pandya, returning from an injury, bowled well and contributed with the bat as Baroda secured an eight-wicket victory.

title: Bomb threat to nuclear plant: Search ops launched; email mentions Putin visit
content: Security agencies launched an extensive search operation in Ajmer, Rajasthan, following a bomb threat email claiming RDX-based explosives were planted at the Ajmer Sharif dargah, district collectorate, and Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant. The email warned of detonation coinciding with Russian President Vladimir Putin's arrival. Premises were evacuated and thoroughly checked, with no suspicious objects found so far.

title: $100 billion erased: Salesforce CEO reassures investors on AI fears
content: Salesforce reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst expectations and offering a boost to CEO Marc Benioff amidst investor concerns about AI profitability. Despite a recent market value drop, the company's AI agent strategy, including layoffs, aims for significant future revenue. Benioff remains optimistic about customer adoption and long-term growth targets.

title: Exclusive: From 'Dying from spice' to 'iPhone revolt': Dutch No.1 opens box of not-quite-chess tales
content: Anish Giri found a crucial turning point in his chess career during the Global Chess League (GCL) last year, overcoming a dip in form and confidence. He shares humorous anecdotes about team bonding, food preferences, and even a playful "iPhone mutiny." Giri sees the upcoming GCL season as a vital warm-up for the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal passes away; PM condoles death
content: Swaraj Kaushal, former Mizoram Governor and husband of the late Sushma Swaraj, passed away at 73 after a brief illness. He was a senior advocate with a distinguished public and legal career. His daughter, MP Bansuri Swaraj, expressed profound grief, finding solace in his reunion with her mother. Leaders mourned his contributions.

title: Putin’s India visit: Trade in focus as New Delhi looks to reduce deficit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India aims to significantly boost economic cooperation, with New Delhi seeking to reduce its trade deficit and expand market access for Indian goods like pharmaceuticals and agricultural products. The trip, accompanied by a large business delegation, is expected to yield agreements in shipping, healthcare, and connectivity, alongside a long-term economic roadmap until 2030.

title: Bill Gates' stark warning to Trump: Cuts mean deaths; no funding fix ready
content: Bill Gates warns President Trump that slashing US global health funding could cause the first rise in childhood deaths this century.  New projections indicate millions more children may die if cuts persist.  While the Gates Foundation is increasing its own spending, it cannot replace government support, leaving vulnerable nations struggling to achieve self-sufficiency.

title: New gratuity rules: How will your payout increase at various salary levels? Explained
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, broaden the definition of 'wages,' potentially increasing gratuity payouts for employees. Fixed-term employees now qualify for gratuity after one year of service. Employers face increased financial liabilities, with clarity needed on past service calculations.

title: 'Agar Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma ka dimaag ... ': Ravi Shastri's bold warning
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma against doubts about their ODI future. He emphasised that players of their stature should not be questioned, stating that if they perform, their critics will quickly fade away. Shastri's remarks come amid discussions about India's long-term team planning for the 2027 World Cup.

title: Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars
content: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

title: Rupee rebounds: RBI support, softer dollar offer relief; currency now 89.96 vs $
content: The rupee recovered from its record low, closing at 89.96 against the US dollar after a softer dollar index and reported RBI intervention. Despite initial weakness due to foreign selling and trade deal delays, the currency found support. Analysts anticipate continued pressure from outflows but potential cushioning from a subdued dollar and possible RBI actions.

title: 'No one had more skin than me': Root's century big relief for Hayden; here's why
content: Joe Root finally ended his long wait for a Test century in Australia, reaching the milestone at the Gabba. This achievement brought relief to former Australian opener Matthew Hayden, who had publicly vowed to "walk nude around the MCG" if Root failed to score a hundred on the tour. Root reached the milestone in 181 balls.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
content: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Warriors linked to $27M Mavericks star as support for Curry; Hield seen as key asset
content: Golden State Warriors and Dallas Mavericks are reportedly considering a straightforward trade: Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. This move addresses roster imbalances, with the Warriors seeking defensive wing depth and the Mavericks aiming to boost floor spacing around their stars. Both teams could benefit from a fresh start and improved team dynamics.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs poised to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
content: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.

title: 'Up to delegation': Govt counters Rahul's Putin meet claim; BJP piles on
content: Government sources have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims that opposition leaders are barred from meeting foreign dignitaries. They stated that the Ministry of External Affairs facilitates official meetings, while engagements outside this framework are at the visitor's discretion. Several foreign leaders have met Gandhi since he became Leader of the Opposition, including Prime Ministers from Bangladesh, Malaysia, Mauritius, and New Zealand.

title: Ashes: Joe Root ends century drought, scores first-ever hundred in Australia
content: Root reached the milestone in 181 balls, batting through a phase when England needed stability and control, and in the process, checked off one of the few achievements missing from his record.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: From Rs 43K tickets to 10-hr delays: Flight disruptions continue - key points
content: IndiGo faces a nationwide operational crisis with widespread flight cancellations and delays, leaving lakhs of passengers stranded and sparking anger. The DGCA has summoned the airline's management to explain the "unprecedented disruptions" and present a plan to stabilize operations during the peak travel season.

title: Putin-Modi meet: How India became Russia’s lifeline - but on its own terms
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in New Delhi for a crucial summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking to bolster energy and arms ties amidst Western sanctions. India navigates a diplomatic tightrope, balancing its historical partnership with Moscow against growing ties with Washington, aiming for strategic autonomy.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices dipped on Thursday amid mixed global trends and weak US economic data, while silver futures saw gains. Investors are cautiously awaiting key US inflation data for clarity on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy. Geopolitical tensions also contributed to a risk premium for precious metals.

title: 'Where is Shami? Why isn't he playing?': Harbhajan fumes after India's defeat
content: Harbhajan Singh urges India to win without Jasprit Bumrah after South Africa's historic 359 chase. He suggests recalling Varun Chakaravarthy to the ODI squad, emphasizing the need for match-winners in shorter formats. The series is now tied 1-1 heading into the decider.

title: 'Govt doesn't want us to meet': Rahul's big charge amid Putin's India visit; Tharoor agrees
content: Hours before Russia President Putin's arrival, Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government for breaking the tradition of allowing the Leader of Opposition to meet foreign dignitaries. He stated this practice, observed under Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh, is now ignored due to government insecurity. Putin's visit will focus on trade, technology, and regional issues, with several agreements expected.

title: 'Targeted kids better looking than hers': Scary confessions of 'serial killer' mom
content: A chilling child murder spree has been uncovered in Haryana, with a 34-year-old woman, Poonam, confessing to drowning at least four children, including her own toddler son. Driven by an urge to kill children more attractive than her own, she meticulously staged the deaths as accidents. The latest victim was a six-year-old girl at a wedding.

title: 180 aboard: Amid nationwide disruptions, IndiGo flight gets bomb threat
content: An Indigo flight from Madina to Hyderabad made an emergency landing in Ahmedabad due to a suspected bomb threat. This incident occurs amidst widespread flight disruptions and cancellations by IndiGo, attributed to pilot shortages and new crew-duty rules, leading to passenger distress and surging fares.

title: Watch: BJP fields ‘Sonia Gandhi’ in Kerala's local body polls; sparks buzz in Munnar
content: A local election in Munnar has taken an ironic turn as the BJP fields Sonia Gandhi, named after the Congress stalwart, against the official Congress candidate. The BJP nominee, daughter of a devoted Congressman, presents a unique challenge for her opponents. This unusual situation is sparking debate, potentially swaying voters and reshaping the local political landscape.

title: IND vs SA: Early SMAT exit for Hardik Pandya! Set to join India T20I squad in Cuttack
content: Hardik Pandya has completed his domestic warm-up and will join the Indian squad in Cuttack on December 6 for the T20I series against South Africa. After recovering from injury, Pandya showed promising form with both bat and ball in two Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy matches.

title: Ashes: Starc rewrites history! Surpasses Akram as most successful left-arm Test pacer
content: Mitchell Starc has become the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test cricket, surpassing Wasim Akram's record of 414 wickets. The Australian achieved this milestone at the Gabba, his debut venue, in his 102nd Test. Starc's early wickets provided Australia with a strong start in the Ashes Test, despite England's recovery.

title: 'Obligated to provide': SC tells states to deploy more staff for SIR; TVK plea flags BLO plight
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed state governments to provide additional staff to reduce the workload of Booth Level Officers (BLOs) involved in EC's SIR exercise. This comes amid reports of excessive pressure and alleged suicides, with the court emphasising case-by-case consideration for exemption requests and ensuring adequate workforce. The direction was issued after TVK's plea flagging BLO plight.

title: 10 foods that boost liver health, reduce fat and improve function
content: Nourishing your liver is crucial for overall health, and diet plays a significant role. This article explores ten scientifically backed foods, including coffee, green tea, and fatty fish, that can help reduce inflammation, protect against fat accumulation, and improve liver enzymes. Incorporating these nutrient-dense options supports the liver's vital functions.

title: ‘Cartel-like behaviour’: FIP issues letter flagging IndiGo’s ‘hiring freeze’
content: Indian pilots' body accuses IndiGo of a hiring freeze and poor planning, leading to flight cancellations and delays. Despite a two-year window for new flight duty rules, the airline allegedly failed to adequately staff operations. The Federation of Indian Pilots urges the DGCA to reallocate IndiGo's slots if commitments to passengers remain unmet due to avoidable shortages.

title: IND vs SA: 'When did Siraj become a one-format player?' - Ex-cricketer slams India's selection
content: Former India opener Aakash Chopra has expressed bewilderment over Mohammed Siraj's exclusion from the ODI setup. He questioned the decision, highlighting Siraj's strong ODI record and contrasting it with the struggles of other young pacers who were preferred. Chopra finds it inexplicable that Siraj has seemingly become a red-ball specialist.

title: Gurgaon hit-&-run: Bizman mowed down by speeding car while cycling; CCTV footage emerges
content: A 58-year-old cyclist was fatally struck by a car in Gurgaon's DLF 2. The hit-and-run incident occurred during his routine morning ride, with CCTV footage identifying the vehicle. Police are actively tracing the owner for arrest, while the community raises concerns about road safety within residential areas.

title: IND vs SA: Heartbreak! When was the last time India lost an ODI despite a Kohli century?
content: A rare defeat for India saw Virat Kohli's brilliant century go in vain as South Africa chased down 358 to level the ODI series. This marked the first loss in nearly seven years despite a Kohli ton, highlighting an unusual outcome.  Aiden Markram's century also played a crucial role in the visitors' successful chase.

title: Putin’s India visit: Private dinner with PM Modi, Rajghat visit — what’s on itinerary
content: President Vladimir Putin arrives in India for a significant visit. He will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi for private dinner diplomacy. Day two includes a Rajghat tribute and summit talks. Discussions will focus on strengthening economic ties, trade, and cooperation in technology and energy. Several bilateral agreements are expected to be signed, charting a roadmap for future collaboration until 2030.

title: Bengaluru techie's death note: How 'dream house' became trap for software professional
content: A Bengaluru techie tragically ended his life, citing relentless harassment from neighbours and civic officials over a Rs 20 lakh demand. Murali Govindaraju was found dead in his under-construction home, leaving a note detailing his torment. His neighbours have been arrested, accused of extorting money under the guise of activism, leading to this devastating outcome.

title: IND vs SA: ‘People who haven't achieved much are deciding Ro-Ko's future': Harbhajan slams critics
content: Former spinner Harbhajan Singh passionately defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, questioning the authority of less accomplished individuals to dictate their future. He highlighted their current strong performances, emphasising they are setting benchmarks for younger players and deserve to be considered for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Harbhajan also advocated for better Test pitches in India.

title: Rupee touches 90! Get ready to pay higher for consumer goods; what may become costlier
content: A depreciating rupee beyond Rs 90 against the US dollar is poised to trigger price hikes across consumer electronics, beauty products, and automobiles. This could negate recent GST rate cut benefits, impacting sales momentum. Manufacturers are planning 3-10% increases from December-January to offset rising import costs.

title: TNUSRB SI admit card 2025 released: Direct link to download hall tickets
content: The Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board has released the hall tickets for the 2025 Sub-Inspector recruitment, with candidates required to download them from tnusrb.tn.gov.in. The Main Written Exam and Tamil Language Eligibility Test will be held on December 21 across 46 centres. TNUSRB has activated multiple helplines for support and issued strict exam-day guidelines, including a complete ban on electronic devices.

title: 'A self-inflicted wound': Why Ole Miss finally had enough of Lane Kiffin
content: How the long courtship of the Rebels coach finally came to a head, amid secret meetings and middle fingers.

title: A final farewell to Lane Kiffin and the rest of the Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

title: AD disputes Kiffin's version of exit from Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter is disputing Lane Kiffin's version of events surrounding the coach's controversial exit for LSU.

title: Siena lacrosse coach Gleason, 41, dies after fall
content: Siena men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason has died, the school announced Wednesday, three days after he suffered a traumatic brain injury in a fall at his home. He was 41.

title: Harden 'just as shocked as you guys' by CP3 exit
content: Clippers stars Kawhi Leonard and James Harden said Wednesday night they were "shocked" when they learned earlier that morning Chris Paul would no longer be their teammate.

title: Messi still noncommittal about 2026 World Cup
content: In an interview with ESPN, Lionel Messi stopped short of definitively confirming he would play at the 2026 World Cup.

title: Giannis exits win with right calf strain, gets MRI
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo was sent for an MRI after suffering a right calf strain against the Pistons, but coach Doc Rivers said Milwaukee has ruled out the possibility of an Achilles injury.

title: 'All-time Raven' Andrews secures 3-year extension
content: The Ravens rewarded Mark Andrews with a three-year, $39.3 million extension, locking in the franchise leader in receptions, receiving yards and TD catches.

title: Nuggets' Murray lethal from 3, pours in 52 points
content: Jamal Murray scored a season-high 52 points, going 19-of-25 from the field and even better from 3-point range (10-of-11) as Denver toppled Indiana 135-120.

title: Brady, Shaq top A-list of assistants for WC draw
content: Tom Brady and Shaquille O'Neal are two of the headliners who will assist with Friday's World Cup draw in Washington, D.C., FIFA announced on Wednesday.

title: What could Milwaukee get in a Giannis trade? Our NBA experts propose five offers
content: Giannis paired with Steph Curry? Kevin Durant? Victor Wembanyama?! NBA insiders break down five deals the Bucks could consider.

title: Which NFL players and coaches have the most at stake? We picked out 17 under pressure
content: Kenneth Walker III, Jonathan Gannon, Shedeur Sanders and Matt Eberflus are among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the NFL season's final five weeks.

title: Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and more
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Shedeur Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: 'I'm a Tiger 'til I die': Why Flau'jae Johnson returned for one last run at LSU
content: Flau'jae Johnson could have left for the WNBA. Instead, she came back for a final season to give LSU all she has left.

title: Three free agents to invest in -- and three to avoid
content: A bargain starting pitcher? Steer clear of Eugenio Suarez? Here are players to target and to be wary of.

title: Why Dan Campbell, Lions are still upset about 'The Dan Skipper Game' vs. Cowboys
content: Skipper has become a cult hero, but the controversial loss to the Cowboys still bothers many of the Lions.

title: NHL Awards Watch: MacKinnon jumps to massive lead in MVP race
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races -- and some clear favorites have emerged.

title: A week to save his job? Is Slot under serious pressure at Liverpool now?
content: Liverpool have suffered nine defeats and a draw in their last 14 games in all competitions. Is it time for manager Arne Slot to go?

title: How one minute at Liverpool ruined Harvey Elliott's World Cup hopes
content: Elliott played one minute for Liverpool and isn't playing at Aston Villa. He can't make another transfer now.

title: Power Rankings: Michigan leaps to No. 1, plus 5 new faces
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: ACC/SEC Women's Challenge guide: Can ACC make up ground after disappointing first month?
content: Can the ACC make noise when LSU-Duke, Notre Dame-Ole Miss, UNC-Texas and more meet on Wednesday and Thursday?

title: What now for Chris Paul and the Clippers? We answered six questions on the stunning news
content: What's next for Chris Paul? What about the Clippers, who are struggling badly? We answered five questions about this big roster shake-up.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Signing day 2026: Virginia Tech raids Penn State, Houston, Vandy go big and more
content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven players you should or shouldn't trust in Week 14
content: Can Joe Burrow lead you to a Week 14 win? These seven players can make or break your fantasy playoff run.

title: One thing to know about 2026 World Cup qualified teams ahead of draw
content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Six Premier League giants eye Rodrygo move
content: Real Madrid winger Rodrygo would consider joining Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United, Chelsea and Tottenham. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Vancouver isn't built around its star, and Müller & Co. are better for it
content: Instead of building the plane around Thomas Müller, the Vancouver Whitecaps asked the Germany legend to fit around their structure -- and it has worked.

title: Why Chelsea believe young star Estêvão is destined for greatness
content: Estêvão has shown his extraordinary talent, but Chelsea have been carefully managing his development.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Fast break: LeBron experiences a career first, Edey emerging as a must-add
content: Eric Moody's looks at the evolution of LeBron James' game, the emergence of Zach Edey, Jay Huff's upside and more.

title: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: India Rolls Out Red Carpet As Putin Lands In Delhi
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: Congress Accuses Madhya Pradesh Assembly Of Altering MLA Questions
content: The winter session of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly sparked a major political storm as Congress MLAs accused the Assembly Secretariat and the state government of "colluding" to alter the questions they submitted for the session.

title: Factor For "Balance In South Asia": Rajnath Singh On India-Russia Strategic Ties
content: India and Russia are amping up cooperation on multiple fronts including defence amid US disapproval and soaring tariff.

title: In PM Vajpayee's 2001 Russia Visit To Meet Putin, A Narendra Modi Cameo
content: The Prime Minister and President Vladimir Putin will meet on Thursday evening, as they have several times since Narendra Modi assumed office.

title: Putin's 'Flying Kremlin' Was World's Most-Tracked Plane En Route India
content: The aircraft carrying Russian President Vladimir Putin was the most tracked flight in the world earlier today, according to Flight Radar 24.

title: Vladimir Putin Lands In Delhi, Private Dinner With PM Modi Tonight: 10 Points
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday evening for a 27-hour visit that India views as a reaffirmation of one of its oldest and most resilient strategic partnerships in the world.

title: Former Mizoram Governor Swaraj Kaushal, Husband Of Sushma Swaraj, Dies At 73
content: Senior lawyer and former Mizoram governor Swaraj Kaushal, husband of former Union Minister Late Sushma Swaraj and father of BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj, passed away on Thursday.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Hits Back After Trinamool MP Objects To Hindi Speech
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday lashed out at TMC MP Saugata Roy for objecting to her speaking in Hindi on a bill, pointing out that the translation technology allows members to listen to speeches in any language.

title: 62 Indian Students Denied Entry To US In Last 5 Years: Centre
content: Sixty-two Indian students have been denied entry to the US by foreign immigration authorities during the last five years, according to data shared by the Centre in Parliament on Thursday.

title: NDTV Special: A Day In Life Of A Poll Officer (BLO) Working For SIR
content: Karuna Aggarwal is among 5.3 lakh BLOs deployed across 12 states as the foot soldiers in the fight to cleanse the voter lists of errors and duplications

title: Ahead Of Putin's India Trip, Rahul Gandhi's "Insecurity" Jab At Centre
content: Hours ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India, Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, has accused the Narendra Modi government of discouraging visiting foreign leaders from meeting leaders of the Opposition

title: Probe Agency Attaches Rs 264-Crore Assets Of Realty Firm In Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has declared realty firm Shine City Group's founder, Rashid Naseem, a Fugitive Economic Offender and secured confiscation of properties worthRs 127.98 crore in a real estate and investment scam.

title: Hundreds Of Ambulances Off The Road In Assam Due To Strike By Drivers
content: The emergency medical response ambulance service of the Assam government has come to a standstill with nearly 800 ambulances remaining off the road due to an indefinite strike by the drivers.

title: Odisha Man Sets Mother On Fire For Denying Money To Buy Liquor: Cops
content: An elderly woman suffered severe burn injuries after she was allegedly assaulted and set on fire by her son in Odisha's Bhadrak district, police said on Thursday. The incident took place at Galaganda village within Tihidi police limits.

title: From Bin Laden To Pak To Nukes, When Putin Spoke To NDTV 23 Years Ago
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's interview with NDTV 23 years ago has some lines that in hindsight seemed prophetic about the times today.

title: Anti-Missile Defences, Radar-Jamming Tech: Inside Putin's 'Flying Kremlin'
content: The aircraft is manufactured by the Voronezh Aircraft Production Association and operated by Russia's Special Flight Squadron, which handles all presidential travel.

title: Putin's Net Worth: Is Russian President Richer Than Billionaire Bill Gates?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has left for India and is scheduled to arrive in New Delhi Thursday evening for a two-day state visit as part of the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit.

title: Delhi To Install 305 Mist Sprayers At 9 Pollution Hotspots: Rekha Gupta
content: The Delhi government is preparing an extensive plan to deploy mist spray technology to combat air pollution in the capital, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said on Thursday.

title: Assam Bans Radical, Jihadi Literatures By Extremist Organisations
content: The Assam government has issued a complete ban on all forms of radical and jihadi literature linked to proscribed extremist organisations, invoking Section 98 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS), 2023.

title: 2 Arrested For Siphoning Fuel From Pipelines For Over 30 Years In Delhi: Cops
content: The Delhi Police has arrested two men, wanted for fuel theft from petroleum pipelines in Rajasthan and several other states, in West Delhi's Vikaspuri, an official said on Thursday.

title: Rankings for Week 14
content:
Field Yates breaks down Matthew Stafford's fantasy Week 13 performance and outlook against the Cardinals in Week 14. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. title: Week 15 Anger Index: Biggest slights, snubs and shenanigans
content: the first college football playoff rankings came out five weeks ago . a few teams jockeying up or down a slot, but effectively no seismic shifts in the landscape . the ACC (Louisville to Cal, Virginia to Wake and Georgia Tech to Pitt) is the only two teams projected in the field in the first ranking .

title: Dyson Daniels is top-25 in CAT leagues because steals matter
content: Dyson Daniels is in the top 25 of this week's fantasy basketball roto and category league player rankings . but he is only 75th in the points rankings because of the steals . the player Rater values his steals more than any single player's scoring contributions except for Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Tyrese Maxey .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day
content: DT Lamar Brown, the no. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year . college football's early signing period started Wednesday and runs until Friday . if a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle .

title: Rating Portugal kit for Ronaldo's final World Cup, other Puma jerseys
content: 42 of the 48 qualifiers confirmed for 2026 world cup draw . a cavalcade of kits will be released in preparation for the event . the event will be staged in Canada, Mexico and the united states next summer .

title: Deadly roads: 1.77 lakh killed in crashes in 2024; maximum ever in a year
content: in 2023, road crashes claimed around 1.73 lakh lives . road transport ministry in a written reply to the Lok Sabha shared the number of people killed in road crashes last year . in another reply, the minister informed the house that 54,433 were killed in NHs .

title: UFC 323 expert picks, best bets: Can Merab or Pantoja be stopped?
content: merab Dvalishvili will defend his bantamweight title for the third time this year . the nine-year veteran from the country of Georgia is taking on former champion Petr Yan . if he gets his hand raised for the 15th consecutive time on Saturday, he'll become the first UFC fighter to win four title fights in a calendar year. pound-for-pound competitor, Alexandre Pantoja (30-5), puts his men's flyweight belt on the line in the co-

title: Bold predictions, must-watch players and more
content: all 64 NCAA women's college volleyball tournament teams were finalized Sunday . the undefeated Huskers earned the no. 1 overall seed, led by first-year coach Dani Busboom Kelly . Nebraska has lost only seven sets this season as it is on the hunt to add a sixth national championship title to its résumé .

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 MLB teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: Women's Power Rankings: Texas unseats UConn at No. 1 after big wins
content: the Players Era Championship in Las Vegas last week prompted a new no. 1 in ESPN's Power Rankings . the gamecocks and longhorns met four times in 2024-25: twice in the regular season, in the SEC tournament final and the national semifinals, with South Carolina winning three of the four . it's not the first time South Carolina coach Dawn Staley and Texas coach Vic Schaefer have been part of a rivalry .

title: 'He ain't leaving': Inside George Pickens' breakout season and future in Dallas
content: a.Q. Shipley and darius Butler break down the Dallas Cowboys' successful offense with players like George Pickens . pickens was a second-round pick in 2022 . he's a child, one Steelers source says .

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: The best games, from Duke, Arkansas, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC Men's Challenge featured a bevy of AP top 25 men's college basketball teams . on Tuesday, the ACC came out swinging, with no. 4 Duke escaping an attempted double-digit comeback by no. 15 Florida by a single point . a one-possession victory for no. 16 North Carolina over no. 18 Kentucky ended the night up 6-2 on the SEC .

title: 🏈 CFP Bubble Watch: Could the ACC get left out?
content: if the ACC beats Virginia, it's not guaranteed a spot in the 12-team field . it could open the door for two conference champions to compete for a national title . at no. 12, the Hurricanes still need some help, but Alabama increased its chances .

title: Ranking Saturday's fights: Roach-Cruz, Foster-Fulton, more
content: lamont Roach and Isaac "Pitbull" Cruz fight for vacant WBC interim title at 140 pounds . sportsmail runs through the best fights to watch this weekend, from San Antonio to Monte Carlo to the gold coast in Queensland, Australia . a rematch with Gervonta "Tank" Davis failed to happen .

title: 'Not everyone can win': Are CFB's blue bloods really losing their grip on the sport?
content: the Commodores hadn't had a winning season in nine years . he and his staff would scour the country for the best underdeveloped recruits . lea says that he doesn't know a world where the team does not belong . "Vanderbilt football will be the best program in the country," he says .

title: From sleeping on floors and taking out loans to Heisman contention
content: quarterback had just ended his freshman season at Virginia . he had a creeping doubt that maybe it was time to give up his quarterback dreams . "the pat McAfee Show" is slated for the big 12 championship vs. the BYU Cougars .

title: Week 15 preview: A look at Championship Week matchups and players to watch
content: if the playoff has taken some of the shine off a championship trophy, there will still be plenty of action this weekend with high stakes . in the big 12, BYU hopes to avenge its only loss -- a blowout to Texas Tech -- and steal a playoff bid . the conference's best team -- Miami -- won't take the field .

title: IFFK 2025: Garin Nugroho to be the filmmaker in focus
content: The 30th International Film Festival of Kerala will be held in Thiruvananthapuram from December 12 to 19

title: M.P. CM releases three Cheetahs into the wild at Kuno National Park
content: On International Cheetah Day, Chief Minister Mohan Yadav frees female Cheetah Veera and two cubs at Kuno

title: Gig workers union seeks Minister’s help to improve drivers’ conditions
content: The union stated that recent reductions in payouts apart from the high fuel costs have led to drivers staring at financial difficulties, and sought the implementation of a per kilometre rate

title: Former Mizoram Governor Swaraj Kaushal dies
content: After Kaushal complained of chest pain in the afternoon, he was rushed to AIIMS where doctors declared him dead; PM Modi and Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta condoled the death

title: Dearness Allowance for judges, judicial officials raised to 58% in Andhra Pradesh
content: The revised rate will be effective from July 1, 2025, says Minister for Law and Justice N.Md. Farooq

title: Central grants to be sought for ₹100 cr. road development, says MLA Mahesh Tenginakai
content: MLA of Hubballi Dharwad Central Assembly Constituency Mahesh Tenginakai has said that it had been proposed to develop the roads in the assembly segment with the help of central assistance at an estimated cost of ₹ 100 crores.

title: Assam bans radical literature linked to outlawed groups
content: The December 3 notification prohibits the publication, circulation, sale, storage, and digital sharing of any material associated with JBM, ABT, and similar groups

title: Leading toy industry investors call on Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu, discuss establishment of a park in Anakapalli dist.
content: G.O. issued in November ratifies acquisition / alienation of 582 acres at Upamaka and Ch. Lakshmipuram villages in Nakkapalli mandal for establishment of a Global Toy Park under the aegis of AP Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Limited

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Students, parents protest against closure of govt. school
content: Taking exception to the proposed move to close the government higher primary school at Benakanakatti village in Dharwad taluk and merge it with KPS (Karnataka Public School) magnet school, scores of students and their parents staged a demonstration before the school on Thursday

title: Kolkata’s bus, not as celebrated as the tram or taxi, to be given its due by heritage fest
content: The fifth edition of the annual ‘The City as a Museum’ event on art and heritage from December 6 to 15 will celebrate this humble mode of transport by converting the bus into a mobile installation

title: Karnataka to prepare a vision document to attract $150 bn from mobile, electronics components manufacturing: M.B. Patil
content: The vision document is currently in draft stage; and the government has sought suggestions from The India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA), the apex industry body for the entire mobile and electronics ecosystem in India

title: Bengaluru techie ends life, neighbours arrested for harassment and extortion over property dispute
content: Based on a 10-page death note recovered from the scene and a formal complaint filed by the deceased’s mother, police have arrested a couple on charges of abetment to suicide and extortion.

title: AVM: a movie production house close to Chennaiites
content: A movie enterprise launched by M. Saravanan’s father A.V. Meiyappan, AVM was a powerful brand, known for both the star-driven tentpole films and the tiny ones riding on fine scripts and good word-of-mouth reviews

title: ADAPT fest in Mumbai celebrates inclusion with fashion show and awards
content: From fashion to awards, the two-day festival celebrated diversity and empowerment, marking the International Day of Persons with Disabilities; actors from Hindi film industry and changemakers joined hands to amplify the message of accessibility and equality.

title: SC tells States to replace distressed BLOs, deploy more staff for SIR work
content: Supreme Court says BLO duties cannot be hampered during Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls

title: PMK founder S. Ramadoss’ supporters protest against ECI in New Delhi
content: They condemned the Election Commission of India for its decision to recognise Dr. Ramadoss’ estranged son Anbumani as the party president

title: India seeks bigger slice of China's expanding tea market at buyer-seller meet
content: India's tea export to China, the world's largest tea producer, stood at $20 million last year, according to China's customs data

title: Health security se National security: Why does Centre want to levy cess on tobacco?
content: The Bill proposes to levy cess on “machines installed, or other processes undertaken in the manufacture of pan masala” to fund India’s ‘health and national security’.

title: Punjab has maximum cases of human trafficking: Jaishankar in Rajya Sabha
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar said the Punjab Government has constituted an SIT and a fact-finding committee to look into cases of human trafficking

title: Shivamogga MP B.Y. Raghavendra highlights plight of areca growers in Parliament, seeks Centre’s intervention
content: The MP said that the yield in areca plantations had come down drastically due to the yellow-leaf disease (YLD) and leaf spot disease (LSD)

title: LDF being challenged by UDF, BJP in Vaduthala East, its bastion for nearly half a century
content: LDF has fielded O.P. Sunil, a former councillor, while the UDF has brought in Henry Austin, sitting councillor of Vaduthala West. BJP has fielded K.B. Manoj Kumar, its Vaduthala area committee president

title: SEIL Energy to set up hospital in Nellore under CSR initiative
content: The company is likely to spend ₹20 crore in a phased manner to construct a 50-bed hospital in 1.87 acres of government land, and seeking another acre to establish a nursing school

title: Health, National Security Cess not on essential commodities, revenues to be shared with States: FM
content: “In addition to 40% GST, Health and National Security Cess will be levied on production capacity of pan masala units,” said Ms. Sitharaman

title: Anoushka Shankar's sitar damaged on Air India flight; airline says it’s investigating
content: The musician posted a video on Instagram showing a deep crack through the lower-rounded end of the musical instrument

title: Political leaders, artistes pay tribute to veteran Tamil cinema producer AVM Saravanan
content: M. Saravanan passed away on Thursday (December 4, 2025) morning due to an age-related illness. He was 86.

title: I trust John Brittas more than Dharmendra Pradhan, says CPI’s Binoy Viswam over his role in PM-SHRI
content: CPI State secretary says the Rajya Sabha MP’s communication with the Union Education Minister was on the withholding of Central funds under the Samagra Shiksha project

title: Residents of Ennore’s Thazhangkuppam want seawall opening to remain
content: A Highways department official says the seawall opening is being closed so that the Ennore Express Road will not suffer further damage in the future

title: Basavaraj Horatti likely to stay on as Karnataka Legislative Council Chairperson amid leadership tussle in Congress
content: A senior Congress leader also indicated that unseating Mr. Horatti, the seniormost member of the house with a record of being in the house continuously for 45 years, is also not going to be easy

title: SC tells States to replace distressed BLOs or deploy more staff for SIR work
content: Supreme Court says BLO duties cannot be hampered during Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls

title: A.P. government allots 480 acres to Adani Infra data centres in Vizag and Anakapalli districts
content: The AP Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Limited earmarked 120 acres in Adavivaram and Mudasarlova villages and 200 acres at Tarluvada in Visakhapatnam district and 160 acres at Rambilli in Anakapalli district to Adani Infra

title: APSCHE gets nod to fill left over convenor quota seats in PG courses
content: One-time relaxation is being given to admit eligible students, who did not qualify in Common Entrance Test  and have not appeared for PGCET-2025

title: Kalaburagi students win Best Poster Award at IIT Bombay ceramics conference
content: College authorities said the award reflects the growing research culture at P.D.A. College and the increasing participation of its students in national and international academic forums

title: Congress expels Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil after court rejects anticipatory bail in rape case
content: In a terse press release, KPCC president Sunny Joseph says Rahul Mamkootathil’s continuation in the Congress has become ‘ethically untenable’ in the wake of accusations of serial sexual predation

title: West Bengal SIR: Polling stations with zero ineligible voters drops from 2,208 to 29
content: Between December 1 and December 3, the number of polling booths that recorded zero dead, duplicate, shifted or absent voters saw a drastic drop

title: 'Visible from space': Astronaut shares orbital view of Mecca 400kms above the earth
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: From AQI and Dharmendra to Operation Sindoor and Women’s World Cup: Indians’ 2025 searches on Google
content: Google released its annual roundup titled ‘India’s Year in Search 2025: The A to Z of Trending Searches’

title: Parliament Session: Gaurav Gogoi invokes Nitin Gadkari's viral video, flags ‘poor quality’ of NH-37; Union Minister assures action
content: The issue of poor quality National Highways was raised in the Parliament, particularly the NH-37 between Jorhat and Dibrugarh in Assam ‘damaged after heavy rainfall’

title: Odisha Government terminates empanelment of IT firm ‘involved’ in recruitment scam
content: The Tier-1 empanelment of Silicon Tech Lab was terminated for ‘violation of multiple material clauses of its service agreement’

title: KTR says BRS will scrap HILT policy after coming to power; suggests land parcels to be used for IT parks, houses for poor or schools
content: While the market value is anywhere between ₹1 lakh to ₹1.5 lakh per square yard, the State Government is trying to transfer these parcels to industrialists for around ₹4,000 rupees per square yard, says KTR

title: Kashmir valley in grip of cold conditions, Pulwama coldest place
content: Pulwama town in south Kashmir was the coldest recorded place in the valley with a minimum temperature of -5.6°C

title: Bengaluru couple working as drug mules held with ₹18.6-crore worth hydro ganja
content: Police said the couple were offered free travel, accommodation, and additional payment to smuggle the drugs from Bangkok. The contraband had been concealed in nine food packets, each weighing around two kilograms.

title: Indian national freed by Houthis after nearly 5-month detention
content: The MEA said the government had been coordinating efforts with various parties to ensure his safe release and return

title: Nearly 40 Indigo flights to and from Kochi airport delayed or cancelled
content: Kochi airport issues travel advisory without naming any particular airline advising passengers to verify the latest flight information with their respective airline

title: Jharkhand ponzi case: ED raids in three cities in Uttar Pradesh
content: At least 20 premises in Noida, Ghaziabad and Meerut are being searched in a case related to Maxizone ponzi scheme

title: New barrier-less highway toll collection system across India within one year: Union Minister Gadkari
content: The new system has been rolled out in 10 places and will be extended across the country within a year, Nitin Gadkari said in Lok Sabha

title: PM on two-day visit to Assam from Dec 20, CM Himanta reviews preparations
content: The Prime Minister, during his visit, will inaugurate the new terminal building of the Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport and also unveil a statue of Bordoloi, Assam's first Chief Minister, at Borjhar.

title: Manipur will face existential crisis if action not taken against deforestation: Former CM Biren
content: Sharing a clip of illicit poppy plantations and deforestation, which he said was from Kangpokpi, former Chief Minister N. Biren Singh said the video showed why recurrent floods were taking place in the State

title: Navy Day: President Murmu salutes bravery of Navy personnel
content: December 4 is observed as Navy Day as an acknowledgement of the Navy's seminal role in the country's defence, and to commemorate its valour against Pakistan during the 1971 war

title: Bhima Koregaon case: Bombay High Court grants bail to former Delhi University professor Hany Babu
content: A Division Bench of Justices A.S. Gadkari and Ranjitsinha R. Bhonsale directed that Hany Babu be released on a personal bond of ₹1 lakh with sureties

title: Humayun Kabir, TMC MLA who gave call for Babri Masjid construction, suspended from party
content: Mr. Kabir said that he will resign as an MLA and announce his own party in Murshidabad on December 22

title: Remarks against Army: SC extends stay on trial court proceedings against Rahul Gandhi till April 22
content: The Bench was hearing Mr. Gandhi's plea challenging a May 29 order of the Allahabad High Court dismissing his plea challenging the trial court's summoning order in the case

title: Cyberabad police portal resumes service after over a fortnight, Rachakonda still offline
content: The website was taken offline on November 15, 2025 after it began redirecting users to external gaming links.

title: Show no sympathy to acid attackers, entire system must respond against them: CJI
content: The CJI-led Bench also sought the Centre's response on plea that acid attack survivors be categorised as persons with disabilities; directed HCs to provide details of pending acid attack trials across country

title: Lean manpower, hiring freeze caused current disruption for IndiGo: Pilots' body
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots said it has urged DGCA not to approve IndiGo's seasonal flight schedules unless they have adequate staff to operate their services "safely and reliably"

title: Gautam Adani meets Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: In a social media post, CM Chandrababu Naidu said they had discussions on key infrastructure projects and emerging opportunities in Andhra Pradesh

title: Watch: Modi and Putin to meet in Delhi today, trade and defence deals likely on the table
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi on December 4, marking his first visit in four years and the revival of India–Russia summits. Talks will focus on trade, defence, energy, and investment, with key outcomes expected in Indian exports.

title: Haryana woman kills three girls over two years, murders son to avoid suspicion
content: When questioned in detail about the motive behind the killing, the SP said the accused told the police that "jo sundar bachhiye hain unse inko nafrat si hai (She harboured hate for beautiful girls)"

title: Kerala Youth Congress leader Shahanas feels the heat as she speaks out against Rahul Mamkootathil, Shafi Parambil
content: A day after Shahanas alleged that she had warned then Youth Congress president Shafi Parambil about ‘predatory conduct’ of Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, who is facing two rape cases, she is expelled from official WhatsApp group of cultural and literary outfit of Congress

title: State must not prosecute citizens without reasonable prospect of conviction: Supreme Court judgment
content: Such prosecutions violate citizens' right to fair process and burdens judicial system already weighed down by "massive backlog", Supreme Court notes

title: India-Russia ties direct outcome of Indo-Soviet partnership cemented in 1955: Congress
content: The Bulganin-Khrushchev visit established the foundations of close Indo-Soviet collaboration of which the Bhilai Steel Plant and IIT Bombay were only two of the early examples, Jairam Ramesh said

title: Live birds, suspected hybrid ganja worth crores seized at Kochi airport
content: The live birds were recovered from a three-member family hailing from Malappuram on their arrival from Thailand. Suspected hybrid ganja worth ₹2 crore seized from a domestic passenger on his arrival from Chennai

title: What do ‘Stranger Things’, John Lennon and Malayalis have in common
content: Kerala Tourism’s social media account connects global cultural icons to the state’s culture, art, heritage, and experiences

title: MoU signed to expand services for children with developmental disabilities
content: The organisations will collaborate on early identification and intervention, capacity building for professionals and caregivers, joint research activities and initiatives aimed at improving community awareness and inclusion

title: IndiGo crisis: 73 flights cancelled at Bengaluru airport on December 4, in total 175 flights cancelled across India
content: Federation of Indian Pilots President Captain C.S. Randhawa attributed flight disruptions, cancellations, and delays to ‘crew shortage’

title: SC hearing on SIR updates: Social audit, more credible way to revise electoral roll, says Prashant Bhushan
content: Supreme Court hears arguments that the Special Intensive Revision allows mass scrutiny of citizenship based on mere suspicion, posing threats of disenfranchisement and statelessness

title: India, Russia Defence Ministers to Co-Chair 22nd Commission Meet in Delhi
content: The two leaders will review the entire range of multi-faceted relations between the two countries in the field of defence, including Military and Military Technical Cooperation

title: KSRTC disburses ₹4.38 crore compensation to dependants of employees, launches new commercial management software e-Vaneejya
content: Under the Saarige Suraksha Accident Insurance Scheme, cheques of ₹1 crore each were handed over to the families of three employees who died due to off-duty accidents and electrocution

title: Putin's India visit LIVE: Russian President Putin arrives in Delhi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will host a private dinner for Mr. Putin this evening to set the tone for the 23rd India-Russia summit talks on Friday

title: Kerala local body polls: Triangular contest shapes Kasaragod’s high-stakes elections
content: The district’s multifaceted politics has ensured that all three fronts wield notable influence despite the NDA’s lack of representation in the Assembly and Parliament
